ca.uwaterloo.lab4_201_11

Class Mapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • View
      • ca.uwaterloo.lab4_201_11.Mapper

  • public class Mapper
extends View
    Mapper class for getting user input reletive to an svg map loaded by the MapLoader The Mapper's coordinates' origin is in the top left hand corner.
    Author:
    Kirill

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mapper

        public Mapper(Context context,
              float sizeX,
              float sizeY,
              float xScale,
              float yScale)
        Initializes a new mapper object.
        Parameters:
        context - context The application context. You can get your application context by calling getApplicationContext() from your Activity
        sizeX - The width of the mapper
        sizeY - The Height of the mapper
        xScale - The number of pixles to use per meter in the X axis
        yScale - The number of pixles to use per meter in the Y axis

    • Method Detail

      • setColors

        public void setColors(int[] colors)
        Sets the colors for the y-values of the graph. Order should match the order of the labels. Colors are represented by an integer that looks like this: 0xAARRGGBB where AA = alpha; RR = red; GG = green; BB = blue; You can initialize an array of colors like this: private int[] colors = {0xffff0000, 0xff00ff00, 0xff0000ff} The array of colors should contain them in this order: {Lines, User point, User path, End point, Start point, Labelled points}
        Parameters:
        colors -

      • addListener

        Adds a Listener for responding to changes in the start and end point.
        Parameters:
        listener -

        public void removeListener(IMapperListener listener)
        Removes an existing listener.
        Parameters:

      • setUserPoint

        public void setUserPoint(PointF point)
        Set the "user point" of the mapper. This is a special point that is drawn in a different color (red by default)
        Parameters:
        point - The value of the point is coppied to the mapper.

      • getUserPoint

        public PointF getUserPoint()
        Returns the last place the user point was set to.
        Returns:

      • setUserPoint

        public void setUserPoint(float x,
                         float y)
        Set the "user point" of the mapper. This is a special point that is drawn in a different color. (red by default)
        Parameters:
        x - in meters
        y - in meters

      • setUserPath

        public void setUserPath(java.util.List<PointF> points)
        Set the "user path". This is a series of points that are drawn as a line of a different color. (red by default)
        Parameters:
        points - The points' location (in meters)

      • addLabeledPoint

        public LabeledPoint addLabeledPoint(PointF point,
                                    java.lang.String label)
        Adds a labelled point. These are a series of points that are drawn with the indicated labels.
        Parameters:
        point - The point's location (in meters). Values are coppied.
        label - The associated label
        Returns:

        Parameters:

      • getStartPoint

        public PointF getStartPoint()
        Returns:
        The point the user has marked as the his current location through the UI.

      • getEndPoint

        public PointF getEndPoint()
        Returns:
        The point the user wishes ti travel to.

      • calculateIntersections

        public java.util.List<InterceptPoint> calculateIntersections(PointF start,
                                                             PointF end)
        Calculates if a given line intersects some other lines of the geometry of the current map
        Parameters:
        start - the start point of the line to calculate (in meters)
        end - The end point of the line to calculate (in meters)
        Returns:
        A list of points where the sample line intersects with the geometry. The intercepts are sorted by distance to the start point.

      • getGeometryAtPoint

        public java.util.List<LineSegment> getGeometryAtPoint(PointF point)
        Parameters:
        point - The point from which to calculate geometry
        Returns:
        All the geometry that starts at or passes through this point as line segments. The Start member of each line segment will satisfy: FloatHelper.areEqual(point, start);

      • getGeometry

        public java.util.List<LineSegment> getGeometry()
        If you want to do something clever with the geometry yourself, you can use this method.
        Returns:
        All the data in the loaded map as line segments

        public boolean onContextItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        A helper method. Call this in your Activity's onContextItemSelected() method. Pass it all the same parameters.
        Parameters:
        item -
        Returns:
        true if the selected item is understood by the Mapper. False otherwise.
